entry.title: Flood Watch issued January 24 at 5:25AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: .Several rounds of rain and thunderstorms are expected across the Tennessee Valley from today through late Thursday night. Storm total rainfall amounts will range from 2-3 inches, but locally higher amounts can be expected with thunderstorms. The risk for flash, areal, and river/creek flooding will be high during this period.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:14AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: LOCALLY DENSE FOG THROUGH EARLY THIS AFTERNOON... Locally dense fog remains over areas along the I-95 corridor between DC, Baltimore, and northeast MD, with visibilities dropping as low as a half mile in spots. Dense fog is hazardous if driving at high speeds. Be prepared for rapidly changing visibility. Slow down and increase following distance.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 11:37AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog for Portions of Our Region Today... As of 1130 AM, visibility across much of southeastern Pennsylvania is near or less than one quarter mile in fog. The lower visibility is being observed to the southeast of Reading and Allentown and just outside of Philadelphia. A Dense Fog Advisory is in effect until 2 PM where the lowest visibility is occurring.
